commits.msg:
Configure Nagios to manage service status alerts

* configure Nagios server and Nagios CGI
* create a Nagios "virtual" hostname pointing to the management VIP
* create service passive checks corresponding to OpenStack service
  statutes sent by LMA collector
* create one Contact with an email for alert notifications

Note: we ship our own Nagios manifest due to the fact that all manifests
around the place are either not compatible for masterless Puppet
environment or not well tested for both Ubuntu and CentOS. Furthermore,
this plugin probably doesn't require all Nagios configuration features.

implements blueprint lma-infra-alerting-plugin

Change-Id: I6faa3a0274b5b7f345a240d9d0ac7925de8a9919

Configure Nagios to monitor all nodes

All hosts are configured with their management IP with a ping check and
have a basic SSH service checks for all IPs (except for public network).

Note: each Nagios Hosts inherit from a Nagios Host Template to add Custom
Variables per host. These custom variables are used within commands (and
could be used elsewhere if it's useful like notification commands)

implements blueprint lma-infra-alerting-plugin

Change-Id: Ia65b0da45a8dd299406dc434a1dcdb8099c62b25

Ensure the friendly coexistence with other Fuel plugins

* use hard coded HTTP port 8001 to allow coexistence with other fuel plugins
* use Apache Puppet module to configure Virtualhost

implements blueprint lma-infra-alerting-plugin

Change-Id: Id82ef1a580d4e39f3dd207b725900d70570ba539

Add SMTP support

* UI options to configure SMTP parameters (without TLS support)
* use command heirloom-mailx as replacement of command mail
 - this tool is available for Ubuntu and CentOS and support SMTP
   authentication.

Change-Id: I6fa19fdc50ec79776ec82c9790e5403011f563ea

Fix typo in the Nagios status information

Change-Id: I04c6c23014a3088ccb3507e421ee23444ad63496

Add tests for Puppet modules

These tests run lint, syntax checker and simple Puppet class tests.
In the mean time this change fixes syntax warnings

Change-Id: I474332ec965689a4e71ad9a235121e01faf5a24c

Add service checks for the LMA backend components

Add simple HTTP checks for Elasticsearch, Kibana, InfluxDB and Grafana.

These checks verify the HTTP return code and the presence of one expected
string in the response.

Change-Id: Iff7c55e6525d86745d710dda3afc01f0cbef6bf1

Be idempotent with concatenated strings

Change-Id: I2ad22d0c55a8ad11c3be81da6cc8ecbeb90ac422

Add support for CentOS 6.5

Change-Id: If20fb41b79c461670c2fdeafd064a49018403677

Update Nagios configuration when scaling up the cluster

A cronjob is responsible to scrutinize the /etc/hiera/nodes.yaml to
detect if new node has been added, then re-apply the puppet manifest.
This is the only way we have with MOS 7.0 to add some dynamic
reconfiguration when adding a new node to the cluster.

To notice that this doesn't work when removing a node since the nodes.yaml is
never updated at this stage.
See for details bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1491027

Change-Id: I9eb75a66a55949f2d852fbcd19a4dc67df1dca25

Hiera controllers no more available

Change-Id: Id39a805d42bee6f0eb2408b09882d16cfecb3b30

Define new role infrastructure_alerting

Change-Id: I700c59c350942776b150d8f9c59bc0b92f3d037d

Allow to deploy this plugin role node alone in cluster

Since the plugin no longer uses the base-os role, the Nagios configuration
generated is wrong because there is no one host found.
By the way this avoids to monitor the infrastructure_alerting node (itself)

Change-Id: I5a6bbefe3f3c7916280996fc7b29e1e5e7464274

Purge default Nagios conf shipped by distribution

A nagios HTTP check is made on the default HTTP port 80 to verify availability
of the Nagios UI but the plugin modifies its HTTP port to 8001 hence
the generation of a false alert.
Let's remove this configuration shipped by Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I5fc1e6e651e2f8accd94e94ba0c6db55fca8dce8

Update tests

- add lint and syntax test for Puppet manifests
- set env GEM_HOME to allow jenkins install gem locally

Change-Id: I4678088dc5ea9ef4cdd5e20feec9880538605067

Locate InfluxDB and Elasticsearch nodes by role

Change-Id: Id9a1fa1bb44ef60e47c01b648a788e017a77493a

Dedicate a Logical Volume for Nagios

A LV of 20GB is dedicated for Nagios which uses /var/nagios for all its data:
 - object_cache_file
 - status_file
 - temp_file
 - log_file
 - debug_file
 - log_archive_path

Change-Id: I5dc67e6326e21af48c59e3acf7fe31541c5af497

Restart the Apache service after CGI configuration

The Apache process needs to be restarted after the configuration of the
Nagios CGI script. Otherwise the running Apache workers fail to access
the FIFO file.

Change-Id: I1c7b4da3e3c2a4dd343cf1af3f6797874fce68c1

Escape SMTP credentials for special characters

And specify the sender email

Change-Id: I5a5f2832d7525068c93f6f4c93061b4ee1353d45

Configure OpenStack service and node clusters for GSE

Change-Id: I6a665bf3f3a81edede08055a7725d9c64feab8ca

Disable notifications for node clusters

Change-Id: Id53b5d5e2c707ea9cb58d9ec767c76c26bf4b7c8

Reorganize Puppet resources to manage Nagios_service

* s/service_status/vhost_cluster_status/ is more accurate now
* provide nagios_service wrapper resource into a lma_infra_alerting::nagios::service

Change-Id: I5781a28fc7a4c34ba214198004af206126767d64

Add missing resource dependencies

Change-Id: Ide1203d76ecd7b537bf3a8f121ce89898c56a17b

Configure the virtual clusters based on Hiera

This change leverages the Hiera data from the LMA collector plugin to
configure the virtual hosts representing the global and node clusters.

Co-Authored-By: Swann Croiset <scroiset@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ideeaffd87a0a52375900da51129822ec65c6024c

Refactor lma_infra_alerting::nagios::services

This change modifies the interface of the
lma_infra_alerting::nagios::services defined type to allow the
declaration of several nagios::service resources with the same
description.

Change-Id: I0af5b8bf6f00107efe7091fe8ac51245f9dd0cc4

Configure the node service checks based on Hiera

This change configures the service checks in Nagios that correspond to
the status messages emitted by the AFD node filters.

Co-Authored-By: Swann Croiset <scroiset@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ie5f45d023489dbfaef4af4bbec204210eb242066

Do not overwrite the SMTP configuration file

The deployer may need to modify the SMTP parameters to enable STARTTLS.
When a node is added or removed in the environment, the Puppet
execution following this shouldn't modify the SMTP configuration.

Change-Id: Ie4b097f474742955c30e6d51ac852db465ca837f

Check private address when VxLAN is used

Closes-Bug: #1518377
Change-Id: I2447fc8a02b8fe826fa154e0e44c2edc8981e18c

Configure a management VIP address

This change configures a VIP address in the management subnet. It also
deploys a Corosync/Pacemaker cluster which is needed for the VIP
fail-over.

Change-Id: I13055ff714dffb893284f9163d3c501ded8b5e74
Implements: blueprint nagios-high-availability

Manage Apache and Nagios with Pacemaker

This change implements the OCF resource agents that manage the Apache
and Nagios services in the network namespace where the VIP address is
running. It configures the necessary Pacemaker resources and makes sure
that the Apache and Nagios services are always co-located with the VIP.

Change-Id: I524157498537fa4a652f2f59e267a0ceb12f8192

Notify the Nagios URL to the Fuel API

Once the plugin deployment has completed, it uses the Fuel API to
register the Nagios URL. The end-users will get the information in
the Fuel UI.

This change also introduces the use of the primary role since only one
node should be responsible for notifying the Fuel API.

Change-Id: Ie5c2495b5bcbce4aec3d5dd2cae247884b231efe

Fix broken dependency in the nagios manifest

We can't change the ownership of the /var/nagios directory before the
Nagios package is installed obviously.

Note that it had no visible impact on the Fuel deployment because
Astute re-runs the manifest if it fails.

Change-Id: Ic88b099fe515555c23312c062044466d4fb53443

Disable checks on the mesh network

The data that used to be present in Hiera is now missing. To avoid
'unknown' check results, this change disables the service checks.

Change-Id: I375711c90b40c1567e324a691141a43e7dbeeb9e
Closes-Bug: #1532869

Monitor all service backends on all nodes

Since Elasticsearch/Kibana and InfluxDB/Grafana can be deployed on
several nodes, we need to check remotely all services on all nodes.

Change-Id: I660f8bd7f5f2435477d3a8e9b4a8898dd1a38d26

Configure no-quorum-policy for Pacemaker

This change makes sure that the no-quorum-policy parameter is 'stop'
when there are at least 3 nodes and 'ignore' otherwise.

Change-Id: If251bb733a8b9d56fc76e6e1a7a27db294775399

Avoid useless Nagios logs

Change-Id: I9dd49f1df5fa060416b33ec1119c7dd3752889f8
Fixes-bug: #1539567

Disable SMTP configuration if needed

If the user disables all notifications then the SMTP configuration is no
more required in UI and there is no need to configure an email address
for the Nagios contact.

Fixes-bug: #1541458

Change-Id: I450fe4e5bd6cd0d2a5bfbd4575c4765ba573b6e6

Remove localhost default monitoring

This configuration is shipped with the package distribution but is
annoying in the context of LMA.

Fixes-bug: #1538655

Change-Id: Iacc9c3ddfd0cc6b2445ea2df905a2efe73b2aace

Disable checks on the storage network

This change disables the Nagios checks on the storage network because
there is no guarantee that the Nagios server has access to this network.

Change-Id: Ied2ed975a01f8bcb4c37f73e5d2403334ab51d99
Closes-Bug: #1545745

Proper way to purge Nagios configuration files

The files purge is now done by the nagios Puppet module in place of
lma_infra_alerting module.

Change-Id: I8d887dcf6aabbe4cb97b102e4cd570e70a3a87dd

Ensure Nagios and Apache services are managed by Pacemaker

The patch moves the Pacemaker configuration of these services to one manifest.

Fixes-bug: #1547402

Change-Id: Iceba637fa5305a3f3411afea85e910a93cf5371d

Fix URLs of the Samba packages

This change also fixes the Puppet manifests to comply with the
140-character limit.

Change-Id: Ie1ce11af9d1f473826d14153c1d962498f5dd5e2

Specify contact_groups for SSH checks

Change-Id: I96db33f015302023f89149f0b9c1877bf9ea6cdb
Fixes-bug: #1559153

Specify contact_groups for HTTP checks

Fixes-bug: #1559151

Change-Id: Ief381ca833c6803e518c5911551a6cb528cc3c64

Add notice to identify StackLight manifests in puppet logs

Change-Id: Ie07a7220ac29216828768489c5ed003345144aa7

Fix manifests to work with MOS 9.0

This patch modifies the parameters passed to the cluster class and
replaces cs_property by pcmk_property. It also replaces the former
function filter_nodes by get_nodes_hash_by_roles.

Change-Id: I0dbe0a4a0198e4b27d0c8169cc98cb2961a2fbb4

Fix manifest when LMA collector isn't here

Change-Id: I47808e65cc49bfc73f5a7de85e59aa93036e91c4
Closes-Bug: #1580938

Implement lightweight WSGI application to replace CGI

Fixes-bug: #1552772
Implement: blueprint scalable-nagios-api

Change-Id: I55613dd650b039142767174d3f19fa9262a2a7bc

Fix deployment when using network templates

Apache can be deployed on any network thanks to network templates. This
change removes all the hard-coded dependencies on the management
network. All port numbers for Apache, Kibana, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB
and Grafana are also moved to Hiera to make it easier to customize if
needed.

It also removes the call to hiera('nodes') since this entry is
deprecated as well as SSH checks because they're not reliable when
network templates are used.

Change-Id: I8f51bda7fee614ac814f0413f8c655b1356b4036
Closes-Bug: #1577358
Closes-Bug: #1550253
Related-Bug: #1514365

Use hiera_hash for network data

Change-Id: Ie578479ed3dac2b3560e1a0cd9703b2e5a6e3e35
Partial-Bug: #1585350

Fix the expected strings for Elasticsearch and Kibana

Change-Id: Ie26b8510ed3ef3910c7d820350415fcf757c0e1c
Depends-on: I068ec6e6981b9b7729d0041be65760206790f615

Configure at least one dummy Nagios service check

Nagios fails to start if no service check is configured, this is the
case when the plugin is deployed without LMA Collector plugin. To make
the CI happy, this patch configures a dummy service check.

Change-Id: Iebd95c5b2df073307a654cf423716b02629a9fc7

Fix indentation in Puppet manifests

Change-Id: I10df7275b146cd8f3fd92751352533495bddd41c

Use 2 Virtual IPs for Nagios

One VIP is used for the Nagios UI and the other for the /status
location exclusively used by LMA collectors to report statuses.
This split will help to enable HTTPS for the Nagios UI and deploy it on
another network while LMA collectors continue to use HTTP over the
"monitoring" network.

These VIPs are allocated by default on the management network.

Change-Id: I3c0df769cb40b540b1afb74d4958e87b58daa12d

Enable TLS for Nagios UI

Blueprint: support-secure-communication

Change-Id: Iac010a698ed92cd3179dae8f9caf2eb6c0f4c1e0

Support multiple Virtual IPs on the same subnet

Fixes-bug: #1594722

Change-Id: I825009dbc2cc3a656c6dbd1b89cd34d77bb7ede3

Configure a dedicated Apache process for Nagios

Change-Id: I1fdf9841331b08332d29eaaacea3ff56afba5c92

Remove useless hiera scheme value

Change-Id: I1e6536a2b5d18bc40fef1741a723b5e390c1a55a

Avoid Apache SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG error

Change-Id: Ie76a691787c3008ee8986b44374ab105004f8408

Implement LDAP integration for Nagios UI

Change-Id: Idc350f3cc793a8be7e4847a78c293c1a77a9a0ee
Implement-blueprint: ldap-integration-in-stacklight

Avoid to start the default Apache2 process

The Apache Puppet module manages by default httpd service,
which leads to start the default Apache2 of the distribution.

Change-Id: I98341e3bcce5b90d111fa7baf9c360963c82cbba

Use Basic authentication for Kibana

Change-Id: I3b0838c7970859eefd38ec4766fb7b7319a066d2

Display port in the link shown in Fuel UI

Change-Id: Ie561f8189eefcfec1cd2456b80167d47fe74ffe7

Specify host_notification_commands with SMTP

Previously, only service_notification_commands was correctly configured.

Change-Id: Id91bbc00bde62110424a7ac51d17d00f6b235d03
Closes-bug: #1559155

Use standard HTTP ports

The Nagios UI uses now port 80 for HTTP or 443 for HTTPS.
The Nagios WSGI application sticks always with HTTP port 80.

Change-Id: I39d22068a6a50d2b1d7ed7eff8b788b1fe204cdc

Configure Pacemaker primitives instead of clones

Change-Id: Id4167b5a4d77ff412694a87bc2978d0cceb5ea8f

Run Nagios in the default network namespace

This is useless to run Nagios in a dedicated namespace and this way, Nagios is
able to communicate with external networks (eg. to send SMTP notifications).

Change-Id: Ica543c29412f109db11dc3bd18ae9e8cecdf1817

Fix resource colocation for MOS 8

This change fixes the declaration of resource colocations for VIP
addresses and Nagios/Apache. The dependent resource must be listed
first in the array (which isn't obvious!).

Change-Id: If6df9dfa31fa07bd2a06f0d07d92f2a9aa0e3c88
Closes-Bug: #1603319

Configure the management gateway in the network ns

Since Apache runs in its own namespace, it has no default gateway and
can't connect to remote services such as LDAP if those aren't in the
same subnet. As long as one of the 2 VIP addresses is located on the
management network, we should configure the management vrouter as the
default gateway in the infrastructure_alerting network namespace.

Note that it solves the issue when network templates are used and none
of the VIP addresses is located on the management network.

Partial-Bug: #1600167

Change-Id: I61dcdddc92aa705839ff10d841bbcfdc36d29caf

Fix SMTP without authentication

Closes-bug: #1558140
Change-Id: I1272414be40d79f2f32c937a0b6e7c852b649af5

Add ordering constraints between Apache and VIPs

This ensures that the Nagios Apache service won't start until the VIP
interfaces are up and running. This is required because the Apache OCF
script needs to tweak the ARP parameters of the VIP interfaces.

Change-Id: I4cc7b7db06cda31064b22e0283af478228202b54
Related-Bug: #1594722

Configure the management gateway on the nodes

Without this change, the nodes are configured to use the Fuel node as
their default gateway. Note that the code path is different between MOS
8 and MOS 9 because of this bug fix [1] that hasn't been backported on
MOS 8.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1541309

Change-Id: I13a504c03091119286b993c626db2379eb27aa29
Closes-Bug: #1583994

Fix issue with LDAP protocol radio button

This patch modifies the label of the radio button used for selecting
the LDAP protocol to make it unique across all the StackLight plugins.

Change-Id: I9fff175af82a5e6bab8666fa5f8c8f1b64926b0c
Partial-Bug: #1599778

Fix lint issue in lma_infra_alerting::nagios

Change-Id: I3ec7ab31e1514d85e30037ba5d1b4cb4ea102717

Alarming refactoring

Change-Id: I611866a4c450d8bd3c4cf8d1237ba91b1bf911c6

Support activate_alarming and enable_notification

With activate_alarming=false, AFDs are not configured in Nagios,
if 'activate_alarming' is not set the AFDs are configured.

if AFDs are configured and 'enable_notification' and is true, the
notification are enabled.

Change-Id: I561fae6e7e62f237bee58771c91c6344332f239d
blueprint: alarming-refactoring

Support activate_alerting and enable_notification properties for GSE

blueprint: alarming-refactoring

Modify the cron job to use specific version of the plugin

This patch modifies the cron job used to update the nagios configuration
to solve a bug that occurs when several version of the plugin are
available. This happens after an upgrade procedure.

Fix Nagios service names for GSEs

Skip service configuration for remote alarms

When an alarm contains metric(s) with collected_on:'aggregator',
the corresponding Nagios service check is skipped.

Change-Id: I758e7bd412a68314e59ec86a40370661525a5af9

Configure logrotate for WSGI logs

Change-Id: I1f0692d85c24687d3a51ee09ce082e3544fd7317

Fix typo nagios.pp

Change-Id: I9abc17831105c0da47b02b12ac90d69c00cc69cc

Remove the dummy check if necessary

The dummy check is configured when LMA collector plugin is not
installed, this dummy check has been added to allow LMA infrastructure
alerting plugin to be tested alone by the CI.

Change-Id: Ifaec285e2913f8a382e26c363acc15da0aee0eb0

Enforce literal strings in Hiera YAML file

Fix typo host.pp

Fix the contact_groups used for hosts

Change-Id: Ie014da3b91c62ddddd24289252df5fdddfeca662

Remove previous Nagios services

Change-Id: I0a17c441389e51fd6bd2e3fd0b29fba81e17ab53

Reduce the concurrent execution likelihood of Puppet runs

The patch removes the crontab at the begining of deployment and increase
the frequency of the cron job responsible to update Nagios.

Change-Id: I095540c36b3f0c0c318ae91702b5671e3122e8c2

Create the dashboard link when upgrading from 0.10.3

Change-Id: I50fd93e686a785ce4b74be83cdabd4f7d4aa313f

Adjust the External Command Check Interval

Nagios will check for external commands as often as possible.

The number of passive checks have been significantly increased and
Nagios can be the bottleneck with 10s interval with large deployments.

Change-Id: Ic7b38203d6641497f5c8d50076903bd7226ed679
